page.title: 17Wellhouse village.
page.content: Wellhouse probably gets its name from the number of wells around the village. There are a number of weavers cottages around the small village green, a wuzzing hole can still be seen in one. The local Liberal Club has a mural of early village life whilst the Cott is a small pub converted from a weavers cottage. The original Methodist chapel was opened in 1844. The Sunday School was built on another site and has also been used as a school since 1882. The old chapel was demolished in 1967 and a new one established in the former infant classroom. The school building has three storeys on the south east side and one on the north west side, the lower storey being two cottages.
